name: jicama
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a rounded, light brown root with white flesh that is eaten uncooked or cooked as a vegetable, or the plant that produces it, originally from Mexico: He made a jicama and orange salad to accompany the meal. Try using sticks of jicama instead of carrot or celery with the guacamole.
More examplesFewer examplesAlthough usually eaten raw, jicama also works really well in soups and stews.Jicama is sometimes known as the Mexican turnip or Mexican potato.Toss the other vegetables with the shredded jicama, and season with mirin, soy sauce, and coriander.
